page.title: 20Newington House & Village
page.content:
Newington is a village of some 30 houses, half old, cottage type dwellings. Three houses are being built. Although the parish is served by the same vicar as Chalgrove, the village identifies more with Stadhampton. There are no facilities whatsoever.
Newington House is suspected to have been built circa 1640; making it the first Italian Renaissance style country house yet identified in this country. The owner Mr.C.Maltin intends restoring it to its original condition. The steepled church has charm but looks to be in a poor state of repair. The road which winds through the village carries fast, through traffic from the M40 towards Reading. The foot path is inadequate.
